stream_context.summary: Kaze models and programs a new folded-paper Thwomp enemy and then spends most of the stream importing, debugging and giving feedback on Biobak’s second major rework of Course 1, all while racing a Thanksgiving dinner deadline.

development_findings.summary: A new “folded-paper Thwomp” enemy is being built: origami/cardboard look, googly eyes that track and shake during attacks, cardboard eyebrows & mouth, ~164 polys, separate low-poly cube for collision, will rattle on impact and sound like snow when walked on.
development_findings.quote: This swamp will have the ability to look around … and the googly eyes just fly around when he does his attack.

development_findings.summary: Kaze added a powerful “soul enemy” off-stream; hits hard, still needs SFX/GFX polish.
development_findings.quote: When he hits you it's actually a very strong enemy … yes I will add sfx and gfx to the game do not worry.

development_findings.summary: Course 1 is receiving its second full Biobak rework for an upcoming demo: new trees, carrot-filled cave, vine-wrapped slide with birdhouses, red castle boss arena, retro flag-pole section with moving platforms, updated lighting and reduced polygon count.
development_findings.quote: We care a lot about course one because we want to make another course one demo—that's why this one has been done again.

development_findings.summary: Major render bugs arose because Biobak disabled Z-buffer, smooth shading and used incorrect two-cycle materials; Kaze spent the stream restoring proper settings, layer order and lighting.
development_findings.quote: How did any of this happen? … There were 15 different properties that were all set wrong.

development_findings.summary: Boss-fight redesign: instead of the king tracking the player on a ‘treadmill’, the king will move to set points while the boulders chase the player, requiring camera & collision tweaks.
development_findings.quote: Quick and easy way to make it 100 % meta would be to have the boulders follow you instead … I like that.

development_findings.summary: Retro sub-area will rely almost exclusively on camera lighting (no global lights) for a flat 2-D look; Kaze added notes to clamp textures and move sun-flare.
Overall scope: 15 courses planned; current work is course 14, course 15 is ‘halfway done’.
development_findings.quote: How many courses are left? … that's course 14 and course 15 is already halfway done.

development_findings.summary: LOD support is deemed unnecessary until Fast64 adds branch C; typical enemy poly budgets range 60-300; level optimisation focuses on draw-order and disabling Z-buffer where safe.
Original plot (Bowser enslaves Yoshis) is being scrapped as ‘too much’ for a Mario game; new stakes still undecided.
development_findings.quote: A whole slavery plot is maybe a bit too much for a Mario game.

context_findings.summary: Time pressure: Kaze must leave at 4:15 PM for Thanksgiving dinner, limiting stream to one hour of work.
context_findings.quote: There is a problem in that I have to go to a thanksgiving dinner today … so I should be heading out around 4 15.

context_findings.summary: Naming philosophy: he never assumes a name is final, always open to something better.
context_findings.quote: I would never just be like yep we found the perfect thing.

context_findings.summary: He reacts sharply to community pressure for release dates, asserting control over schedule.
context_findings.quote: Please release before Christmas … Please shut the fuck up. Leave me be.

context_findings.summary: Design stance: prefers some visual–collision mismatch for challenge and dislikes overused ‘blue light force barriers’.
context_findings.quote: Games have gotten too easy. We need a bit of difficulty.

context_findings.summary: He jokes about a ‘backseat gamer AI’ that would take control from players, showing playful design experimentation.
context_findings.quote: It would just control Mario for you and be like you're bad at this let me do it.

biobak.summary: Delivered ‘Course 1 update.zip’ with extensive geometry, texture and lighting changes, aiming to finish the rework the same day.
biobak.quote: Oh you think you can get done today Biobak? that would be insane.

biobak.summary: Supplied the base folded-cube model that Kaze used for the new Thwomp.
biobak.quote: I'm using the latest model Biobak made because this is a folded cube.

biobak.summary: Unintentionally broke materials by altering Z-buffer, smooth shading and pipeline coherency settings, requiring debugging.

zeina.summary: Is willing to recreate the missing red Goomba banners for the boss castle.
zeina.quote: Zeina says the farm will offer her to make a red banner.

key_stories.title: Building the Folded-Paper Thwomp
key_stories.summary: Kaze designs a brand-new Thwomp enemy that matches the papercraft theme by experimenting live with origami folds, shiny vs matte textures, cardboard eyebrows and googly-eye rigging.
key_stories.challenge: Make a classic stone Thwomp feel like handmade paper without losing its recognisable silhouette.
key_stories.process: Iterates on bevels, UV folds, material shininess and eye rigging while consulting chat and Biobak.
key_stories.outcome: Settles on a folded-cardboard cube with movable eyes, angry cardboard features and planned rattling/snow sounds.
key_stories.key_quote: Does he look enough like he's made out of construction paper?

key_stories.title: The Shader Fix Panic
key_stories.summary: On importing Biobak’s Course 1 file, Kaze discovers severe render errors caused by disabled Z-buffer and wrong material settings, forcing an impromptu debugging session.
key_stories.challenge: Sky, mushrooms and background objects render incorrectly, showing clipping and colour glitches.
key_stories.process: Identifies missing Z-buffer, smooth shading and incorrect two-cycle states, restores layer order, clamps textures and adjusts lighting presets.
key_stories.outcome: Course 1 renders at 50 FPS with correct draw order; Kaze documents fixes for future imports.
key_stories.key_quote: There were 15 different properties that were all set wrong.

key_stories.title: Re-thinking the Boss Fight
key_stories.summary: The current treadmill-style Bob-Omb King fight feels awkward, so Kaze and Biobak brainstorm a fresh mechanic.
key_stories.challenge: King appears to ‘slide’ in place while following the player, breaking immersion.
key_stories.process: Chat proposes letting boulders, not the king, chase the player; Kaze notes the idea and outlines necessary logic changes.
key_stories.outcome: New design note: king relocates, boulders track player, opening space for better animations and pathing.
key_stories.key_quote: Quick and easy way to make it 100 % meta would be to have the boulders follow you instead … I like that.
